paper_abstract: For the practical simulation and performance evaluation of mobile-to-mobile (M2M) communication systems, it is desirable to develop accurate M2M channel simulation models for more realistic scenarios of non-isotropic scattering. In this paper, by using a 'double-ring' concept to describe M2M non-isotropic scattering environments, we propose new deterministic and stochastic sum-of-sinusoids (SoS) based simulation models. The proposed simulation models extensively consider the distributions of the angle of arrival (AoA) and the angle of departure (AoD), and thus provide a good approximation to the desired statistical properties of the reference model. Copyright (C) 2009 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.
paper_title: New deterministic and stochastic simulation models for non-isotropic scattering mobile-to-mobile Rayleigh fading channels
